author: kommstar
content: What about an infographic, do they tend to go more viral since the data can be digested in a few minutes easily and then passed on?

author: kommstar
content: I was thinking something a bit more detailed. Maybe an update on the various CL and EL clients, short links to their project pages, updates on the (dev) test nets and when you expect a public testnet to be spun up, maybe some sort of (vague) progress bar of how far we have to go til merge, cool new projects and features being built out by members of the community, L2 updates.

author: kommstar
content:
Vitalik puts out his info graphics which help up to understand what the state of new features in Ethereum is and how far along they are, great for understanding all the components currently under development but these time lines are in years, not months.

https://twitter.com/VitalikButerin/status/1466411377107558402

author: timbeiko
content: Some of this is available here: https://notes.ethereum.org/@djrtwo/kintsugi-milestones

author: timbeiko
content: But yeah, I think the closest to what you want is probably something like This Week in Ethereum. Unfortunately, there is no "central coordinator" for all these efforts, so the best is usually to aggregate the various resouces.

author: kommstar
content: Which is what I do, but I am all in on Eth and I don't mind searching for the details.

author: kommstar
content: A more casual user may not have the time or inclination to do so, and I think that is what OP was trying to address

author: Deleted User
content: Honestly, most users won't care regardless of the EF communication. Looking at reddit, I see 1.2 mil subscribers at /r/ethereum and 1.9 mil for /r/ethtrader. That's 60% more. If someone is truly interested, he can join this Discord and have all the information they need.
